title: Death toll in great earthquakes as of 2016
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Death toll for 10 number of Earthquakes.
The Death toll is appeared to be the highest at Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and lowest at Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005).
The difference of Death toll between the highest and lowest Earthquake is 168662.0.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Death toll for 10 number of Earthquakes.
Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has the highest Death toll and Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) has the lowest Death toll.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Death toll for 10 number of Earthquakes.
The Death toll is appeared to be the highest at Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and lowest at Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005).
The difference of Death toll between the highest and lowest Earthquake is 168662.0.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Earthquake in the x axis and Death toll in the y axis.
Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has the highest Death toll and Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) has the lowest Death toll.
Earthquake Haiti (2010) has the second highest value for Death toll.
There is a difference of 168662.0 between the maximum Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and minimum Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005).

Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) is higher than any other Earthquakes with value 242000.0, followed by Haiti (2010), and Nanchang (China 1927). Down to Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) with the lowest value 73338.0.
The Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) tends to be 1.61 percent higher than average.
The Death toll is 1499092.0 if we add up values of all Earthquakes.
